references.formattedCitation: Talbert, Richard J. A. Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World : Map-by-Map Directory. 2 vols. Princeton, N.J.: Princeton University Press, 2000.

description: Originally a Phoenician colony founded ca. 1100 B.C., Lepcis Magna became a prominent Roman city and birthplace of the emperor Septimius Severus.

history.comment: created darmc citation to preserve project linkage after DARMC location was withdrawn
